headline: What is Wall Street seeing as Nike sales continue to struggle?
summary: Nike stock (NKE) continues to slide Friday morning coming off the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs. Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi dissects Nike's earnings results and guidance figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: What is Wall Street seeing as Nike sales continue to struggle?
content.description:
Nike stock (NKE) continues to slide Friday morning coming off the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs.

Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi dissects Nike's earnings results and guidance figures.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Nike Sinks After China Sales Plunge, Delaying Turnaround
summary: The world’s largest sportswear company expects revenue to be down in the low-single digits in the three months that started Dec. 1, a surprising turn after two straight periods of growth.  While Nike is making progress, especially in North America and the running category, investors are eager for the company to make headway in other areas of the business that are lagging.  Converse sales plunged 30% in the latest quarter, while Greater China was down 17%.

content.title: Nike Sinks After China Sales Plunge, Delaying Turnaround
content.summary: The world’s largest sportswear company expects revenue to be down in the low-single digits in the three months that started Dec. 1, a surprising turn after two straight periods of growth.  While Nike is making progress, especially in North America and the running category, investors are eager for the company to make headway in other areas of the business that are lagging.  Converse sales plunged 30% in the latest quarter, while Greater China was down 17%.

headline: Nike Stock on Pace for Worst Day Since April Tariff Shock
summary: Nike shares sank after the sportswear maker projected sales would drop this quarter, weighed by ongoing China weakness.   Shares stood nearly 10% lower at $59.11 in morning trading. If those losses hold through the close of regular trading, it would be their biggest one-day drop since April 3.

content.title: Nike Stock on Pace for Worst Day Since April Tariff Shock
content.summary: Nike shares sank after the sportswear maker projected sales would drop this quarter, weighed by ongoing China weakness.   Shares stood nearly 10% lower at $59.11 in morning trading. If those losses hold through the close of regular trading, it would be their biggest one-day drop since April 3.

headline: Adidas, Puma shares dip after Nike sales warning, margin decline
summary: Investing.com -- Shares in sportswear giants Adidas (ETR:ADSGN) and Puma (ETR:PUMG) fell Friday, a day after Nike (NYSE:NKE) warned that sales would decline in the current quarter amid ongoing weakness in China and continued pressure at the Converse brand.

headline: Nike Warns of Sales Decline as China Weakness Persists
summary: Nike warned that sales will decline this quarter amid persistent weakness in China and at its Converse brand. The world's largest sportswear company expects revenue to be down in the low-single digits in the three months that started Dec. 1, a surprising turn after two straight periods of growth. Bloomberg's Jennifer Creery reports.

content.title: Nike Warns of Sales Decline as China Weakness Persists
content.description: Nike warned that sales will decline this quarter amid persistent weakness in China and at its Converse brand. The world's largest sportswear company expects revenue to be down in the low-single digits in the three months that started Dec. 1, a surprising turn after two straight periods of growth. Bloomberg's Jennifer Creery reports.
content.summary: Nike warned that sales will decline this quarter amid persistent weakness in China and at its Converse brand. The world's largest sportswear company expects revenue to be down in the low-single digits in the three months that started Dec. 1, a surprising turn after two straight periods of growth. Bloomberg's Jennifer Creery reports.

headline: Should Nike’s Margin Squeeze and China Slowdown Reshape How NIKE (NKE) Investors View Its Turnaround?
summary: Nike has already reported fiscal 2026 second-quarter results, with sales inching up to US$12,427 million while net income dropped to US$792 million and margins compressed amid heavier promotions and higher tariffs. Beneath the headline beat on revenue, the contrast between strong North America growth and a sharp 17% sales slide in Greater China underlines how regional imbalances and profit pressure are shaping Nike’s ongoing turnaround under CEO Elliott Hill. Now we’ll examine how this mix...

content.title: Should Nike’s Margin Squeeze and China Slowdown Reshape How NIKE (NKE) Investors View Its Turnaround?
content.summary: Nike has already reported fiscal 2026 second-quarter results, with sales inching up to US$12,427 million while net income dropped to US$792 million and margins compressed amid heavier promotions and higher tariffs. Beneath the headline beat on revenue, the contrast between strong North America growth and a sharp 17% sales slide in Greater China underlines how regional imbalances and profit pressure are shaping Nike’s ongoing turnaround under CEO Elliott Hill. Now we’ll examine how this mix...

headline: Nike's turnaround plan taking longer than expected: Analyst
summary: Nike stock (NKE) continues to slide Friday morning coming off the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs. Wedbush Securities senior equity research analyst on apparel & footwear, Tom Nikic, joins Julie Hyman in assessing Nike's progress in its turnaround plan under CEO Elliott Hill. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Nike's turnaround plan taking longer than expected: Analyst
content.description:
Nike stock (NKE) continues to slide Friday morning coming off the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs.

Wedbush Securities senior equity research analyst on apparel & footwear, Tom Nikic, joins Julie Hyman in assessing Nike's progress in its turnaround plan under CEO Elliott Hill.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
content.summary: Nike stock (NKE) continues to slide Friday morning coming off the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs. Wedbush Securities senior equity research analyst on apparel & footwear, Tom Nikic, joins Julie Hyman in assessing Nike's progress in its turnaround plan under CEO Elliott Hill. headline: Nike earnings: Brand still dealing with ongoing problems in China
summary: Nike stock (NKE) is sliding in Friday's trading session after the athletic apparel titan's fiscal second quarter release that beat earnings and revenue estimates. While Wall Street continues to appear bullish on the retail stock, the brand continues to struggle to breathe new life into its sales after a long year of discounting and navigating trade tariffs. BMO Capital Markets Managing Director Simeon Siegel speaks with Jared Blikre about Nike's latest earnings release and the headwinds coming from the Chinese consumer market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Why Columbia Sportswear (COLM) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: Shares of outerwear manufacturer Columbia Sportswear (NASDAQ:COLM) fell 2.6% in the afternoon session after its competitor Nike forecasted a low-single-digit percentage revenue decline for its current quarter, raising concerns about the health of the athletic apparel industry. The news came after Nike released its second-quarter financial results.

headline: Nike's Turnaround Is 'Going to Take Time.' Meanwhile, The Stock Is Sliding.
summary: A year into his tenure, CEO Elliott Hill says Nike is seeing improvement, but still midway through its turnaround.
